xml.name: option-vsearch-clustermethods
xml.option: Abundance-based greedy clustering (agc)(VSEARCH)
Distance-based greedy clustering (dgc)(VSEARCH)

param.label: metric - select the metric in the opticluster method
param.help: Options are Matthews correlation coefficient (mcc), sensitivity (sens), specificity (spec), true positives + true negatives (tptn), false positives + false negatives (fpfn), true positives (tp), true negative (tn), false positive (fp), false negative (fn), f1score (f1score), accuracy (accuracy), positive predictive value (ppv), negative predictive value (npv), false discovery rate (fdr). Default=mcc.

param.label: Initial randomization
param.help: singleton: each sequence is randomly assigned to its own OTU; oneotu: all sequences are assigned to one otu

param.label: set the stable value for the metric in the opticluster method
param.help: The delta parameter allows to set the stable value for the metric in the opticluster method. To reach a full convergence, set delta=0.

param.label: Tax summary output type
param.help: The detail format outputs the totals at each level, where as the simple format outputs the highest level

param.label: Print level
param.help: specify taxlevel of your *tax.summary file to print to. Options are 1 to the maz level in the file. The default is -1, meaning max level

**Mothur Overview**
Mothur is a comprehensive suite of tools for microbial ecology community. It is initiated by Dr. Patrick Schloss and his software development team in the Department of Microbiology and Immunology at The University of Michigan. For more information, see Mothur-Wiki_.
